2010.description: . • Improve bflex with respect to feedback from existing users. The new computer program system is termed Bflex2010.

1992.description: ) and supported by the oil industry through several industry and joint industry projects until now. The latest developments ﬁnalized in 2019 were related to enabling lateral buckling calculations of deep water risers.

ITCODE0.description: and ITCODE1, see Eq. (2.3) and Section 2.20.14. These models are linked to the PIPE52 beam element and the HSHEAR352 sandwhich beam element. In both cases, the axisymmetric stresses and layer contact pressures are found by applying the

ITCODE31.description: mcm and ITCODE1 sbm models, leading to improved accuracy in fatigue prediction, see (Sævik, 2011). Then in order to enable more ﬂexible modelling features, Bflex2010 was developed,

HCONT473.description: considers contact between HSHEAR353 and HSHEAR363 or HSHEAR364, however, also including their respective centreline axial and torsion motions in the rel- ative displacement and friction. The element allows for arbitrary large displacement

TACT.description: in addition to the desired material properties, see Section 2.20.12, Section 21 2.20.13, Section 2.20.11, Section 2.26.2, Section 2.26.1 and Section 2.26.12.

CODE0.description: as referred to above. Both old (default) or new friction models are avail- able.Linked to the FLEXCROSS automatic ﬂexible pipe modelling. • Repated Unit Cell (RUC) modelling based on ITCODE1 as referred to above.

CROSS.description: automatic ﬂexible pipe modelling. • Repated Unit Cell (RUC) modelling based on combining HSHEAR364 and HCONT464 elements for cylindric layers and pressure spirals/tapes.

HEAR353.description: with HCONT463 or HCONT453 to establish sbm model for tensile armour layers. Both old (default) and new friction model are available. Linked to the 353FLEXCROSS automatic ﬂexible pipe modelling. For lateral buckling

HEAR364.description: or HSHEAR363 with HCONT464 for cylindric layers and pressure spi- rals/tapes. Then combining HSHEAR353 with HCONT463 or HCONT453 for helix layers. Several friction models are available. If sideways contact are deemed

TYPE.description: : The analysis type which may be STATIC or DYNAMIC .

NODID.description: : Node ID number j. RO: Outer radius at node j (unit: L).

MASTERNODE.description: : Master node number at which the applied boundary condition is re- ferred. Only for SPECIAL.

XANG.description: : Tait–Bryan angle around local x axis, applied to deﬁne the orientation of the applied boundary condition measured relative to the local system of the master node. Only for SPECIAL (unit: rad).

YANG.description: : Tait–Bryan angle around local y axis, applied to deﬁne the orientation of the applied boundary condition measured relative to the local system of the master node. Only for SPECIAL (unit: rad).

ZANG.description: : Tait–Bryan angle around local z axis, applied to deﬁne the orientation of the applied boundary condition measured relative to the local system of the master node. Only for SPECIAL (unit: rad).

LOAD2.description: : Load for last element. Linear load interpolation is applied for the intermediate elements. If the REPEAT command is introduced then the previous sequence of load generation

CTYPE.description: : Cross-section layer type identiﬁer (character string of length 4). In addition to the same layer types for FLEXCROSS, a TAPE representation is allowed for

PDTYPE.description: : Type of contraint equation. Allowed types are:

DISPVAL.description: : Prescribed displacement value (unit: L for dof 1-3, R for dof 4-6). The dispacement value is multiplied with the time dependent load factor

HISTNO.description: : History id, specifying the time dependent load pattern. See Section 2.35.

SLNOD.description: : Node id of the prescribed (slave) node.

PDTYP.description: : Type of constraint, can have values LOCAL or GLOBAL.

THIST0.description: : Time history number for C0, refering to the deﬁnition of the time dependent load factor, see Section 2.35.

THIST1.description: : Time history number for C1, refering to the deﬁnition of the time dependent load factor, see Section 2.35.

IGAP.description: : Control parameter used to control contact element features depending on con- tact element type. For cont164 the appropriate values are IGAP ≥0 or IGAP < 0. If IGAP ≥0

GRPNAME.description: : Name of the contact element group.

MASTERNAME.description: : Name of the master element group. 35

SLAVENAMEI.description: : Name of the slave element group or the name of a contact surface, see the COSURFPR command. If the element type of the contact element group is sea150, then the master group shall have the same name as the sea group, and

IS1.description: : First slave element in contact range. Dummy for hcont and cont152 elements.

ISN.description: : Last slave element in contact range. Dummy for hcont and cont152 elements. Search for contact is carried out between IS1 and ISN. TX: Time at which the contact elements are to be activated in the local x direction.

MAXIT.description: : Maximum number of iterations. Must be given if STEPTYPE is given.

ISOLVR.description: =1. The number of accepted eigenvalues and the relative error for each eigenvalue are printed to the log ﬁle. The maximum number of eigenvalue iterations is for the time being set

NPOINT.description: : Number of integration points around the cross section. This is used both for the pipe non-linear material elements and for the visual model meshing.

IPRINT.description: : Print parameter One or two digits can be applied to set print of model infor- mation to output ﬁle (.bof), and print of timestep and iterations to log ﬁle (.blf) and print to screen. In particular print of time and iteration information can be

CONR.description: : Convergence radius. Recommended value is 10−5–10−7. Overrules the global convergence radius from the CONTROL card in Section 2.6. Must be given if

ISTRES.description: : Start procedure parameter which may have the following values: STRESS-

FREE.description: , RESTART, EIGEN or AUTOSTART. STRESSFREE means that the ini- tial conﬁguration is stressfree. RESTART means restart from a previous analysis.

IRESTP.description: : Load step at which the eigenvalues are wanted.

NEVAL.description: : Number of eigenvalues wanted. If a negative number is given, the eigenvalues are animated from irestp on the raf ﬁle

IN1PIP.description: : The ﬁrst pipe element ID number at the start of the catenary.

IN2PIP.description: : The last pipe element ID number at the vessel end.

INCPIP.description: : The node increment along the element segment (normally 1).

NROLLS.description: : Number of roller stations along stinger.

IVSNOD.description: : Vessel pipe node id (if relevant), i.e. the pipe node where the pipe is termi- nated in the tensioner. In order to move associated vessel model nodes the same

KPTDP0.description: −L Figure 2.6: Position of pipe in free span analysis (ICATEN = 0). Figure 2.7: Vessel deﬁnition.

STINGERGRP.description: : Name of stinger contact element group (may be NONE for e.g. J-lay).

VESSELGRP.description: : Name of vessel group (may be NONE). This parameter is used to iden- tify whether there is a vessel and which elements that are used to represent the

MLINEID.description: : Material ID of the route line, i.e. the center line if several lines are given.

KP1.description: : Starting point of material properties (KP value).

KP2.description: : End point of material properties (KP value).

COFILE.description: : Name of the ascii dataﬁle containing the seabed geometry description.

NLINES.description: : Number of seabed lines in contact surface ﬁle. Must be an odd number 1,3,5 etc. A positive number of lines means that the data is on the standard format in Section 2.8.1.

KP0.description: : KP-value for 1. point in contact surface dataﬁle, i.e. the KP-value for the ﬁrst data line in COFILE.

YSTART.description: : y-coordinate at start of contact surface relative to the global coordinate system (unit: L).

ANGSTART.description: : Angular position angle θ, see Fig. 2.28(unit: R).

MLINEIDN.description: : Material ID of additional seabed lines. To be able to apply several seabed lines, they must also be deﬁned in the contact surface ﬁle.

IDLINE.description: : Optional. A number between 1 and NLINE, specifying that this seabed line is the only one to be used. The ﬁrst seabed line is the center line coinciding with the route line, and any succeeding

NINTER.description: : Number of intervals within the segment.

CURVCODE.description: : Curve code, given as a character string which may have the following 47

INTERFACE.description: : The local interface number. Interface numbers higher than 1 are used to describe holes in a geometry.

CCURVE.description: : Curve code, given as a character string of length 2. The legal options are: S :

ICODE.description: ̸= 1 The stress inside the cross sectional area is not calculated. Transverse curvature parameter The transverse curvature parameter is used to avoid zero stiﬀness in the transverse direction (TRCURP). The default value is

MYPIPENAME.description: : Name of BFLEX2010 cross sectional geometry.

ENDFAC.description: : end shear spring stiﬀness factor for element type HSHEAR352. By setting a negative value, all elements will have the same friction spring characteristis. The

EL1GRP.description: : This is a text string to be speciﬁed either as LAY1-LAY2-ELGRPNAME1-

DISFAC.description: : Maximum relative displacement in shear spring (last point on shear spring material curve, see old Bﬂex).

FORFAC.description: : Maximum non dimensional force (last point on shear spring material curve, see old Bﬂex).

GEOFAC.description: : Scaling factor for the geometric stiﬀness. A value greater than 1.0 can be applied to stabilize the pipe-bellmouth interaction behaviour. Optional, default

ILAEXT.description: : The interface number (outside outer layer = number of layers) where external pressure is applied.

IELBFL.description: : Element where BOUNDARY/PFLEX model is located (dummy as per now as the BOUNDARY/PFLEX functionality only exist for FLEXCROSS, see Sec-

FIMOD.description: : Angle position of BOUNDARY model (dummy as per now as the BOUND-

NELGR.description: : Number of element groups related to core and tension armour layers

EL2GRP.description: : Name of element group 2. Representing tensile armour layer 1. Either a

ELNGRP.description: : Name of element group N representing tensile armour layer N.

MATNAME.description: : For the contact element cont126: Name of contact surface. See the

AREA.description: : Cross section area of tendon. Dummy for CTYPE=THER, and if CCODE̸=MANUAL. (Unit: L2).

IKS.description: : Inertia moment about weak axis of tendon. Dummy for CTYPE=THER, and if

WIDTH.description: : Width of tendon. Dummy for CTYPE=THER, and if CCODE=MANUAL. (Unit: L).

PRLOC.description: : The local pressure on the inside of the layer. Optional and requires that

NLAYER.description: . (Unit: FL−2) Note: If NLMAT̸=NONE, material type for this group must be ELASTOPLASTIC. Note: If CCODE=MANUAL the remaining cross-section parameters must be speciﬁed

DATA.description: group, the program will calculate the cross-section data based on the boundary curve given. The remaining data are therefore dummy in this case. Note: The contents of the ﬁle CFATFL are described in Section 2.10.7.

ILAINT.description: : The interface number (inside inner layer = 1) where internal pressure is applied

ARY.description: /PFLEX functionality only exist for FLEXCROSS, see Section 2.10.1) (unit: deg)

NLAYGRP.description: : Number of layer element groups applied to describe the cross-section

ELGRPNAME2.description: or LAY1-LAY2-ELGRPNAME1. LAY1 and LAY2 refers to the cross-section layer number starting from the inside. If one elgrpname reference is given it must refer to a structural element group (either hshear353 for the ten-

ELGROUPNAME1.description: is a contact element group, this will be taken from the next layer. In the opposite case this will be taken from the current layer. The layer numbering starts from the inside (LAY1=1=normally carcass) For the pressure

MANUAL.description: : Time stepping is carried out as normal, but given MAXIT overrules the one given in the CONTROL card.

NBNOD.description: : Local node number in the bending stiﬀener deﬁnition. 63

RKS.description: : External wrapping fraction η (Range: 0-1). Hence the hydrodynamic diameter that will be applied to calculate drag and mass forces will be: D = (1 −η)Dop +

NOTH.description: : Number of integration segments in thickness direction.

MATIN.description: : Material name for inside bending stiﬀener

MATOUT.description: : Material name for outside bending stiﬀener 2.10.7

SIGUTS.description: : Ultimate stress for mean stress correction (unit: F/L2) Then a number of NFDPO lines on the format:

NFDPO1.description: The number of points in the fatigue S-N diagram for longitudinal failure mode. R1 The R-ratio deﬁned as σmin/σmax for the S-N-diagram for all values of IGERB

IGERB1.description: Method for taking the mean stress into account for longitudinal failure mode. = 0 No mean stress is taken into account. Stress range calculated considering longitudinal stress range for tensile armour, von Mises for pressure armour.

INTCO1.description: Method for interpolation in S-N diagram: = 1 Both stress and N in log scale. = 2 Stress in linear scale, N in log scale.

SCF1.description: Stress concentration factor longitudinal failure mode.

IGERB2.description: Method for taking the mean stress into account for transverse failure mode as deﬁned for IGERB2 above.

INTCO2.description: Method for interpolation in S-N diagram: = 1 Both stress and N in log scale. = 2 Stress in linear scale, N in log scale.

SCF2.description: Stress concentration factor transverse failure mode. 66

SCFMAX.description: Stress concentration factor to be used for the mean axial stress (unit: -).

SCFMBY.description: Stress concentration factor to be used for the mean normal curvature stress (unit: -).

SCFMBZ.description: Stress concentration factor to be used for the mean transverse curvature stress (unit: -).

SCFDAX.description: Stress concentration factor to be used for the dynamic axial stress (unit: -).

SCFDBY.description: Stress concentration factor to be used for the dynamic normal curvature stress (unit: -).

SCFDBZ.description: Stress concentration factor to be used for the dynamic transverse curvature stress (unit: -). By specifying the last 6 parameters the SCF1 and SCF2 parameters will be overruled.

POINT.description: : The point number =1- .... Number of points.

SRANGE.description: : Stress range (in increasing order), starting with the minimum threshold value (unit: F/L2)

NCYFAL.description: Corresponding number of cycles to failure. Comment: Only numeric values in the fatigue data ﬁle.

MSTAT.description: : Parameter for choosing mass matrix type: 1 : Concentrated mass matrix.

ALPHA.description: : α in the HHT-α time integration method.

BETA.description: : Tension/torsion coupling parameter β. For a tensile armour of a ﬂexible pipe with lay angle α and radius R, the strain due to centreline strain and torsion is:

GAMMA.description: : γ in the HHT-α time integration method.

NODEID2.description: : ID of node 2 (optional, applies only for TYPE=4).

DOF2.description: : DOF of node 2 (optional, applies only for TYPE=4). If the optional numbers NODEID2 and DOF2 are speciﬁed the relative displacements between the two nodes will be presented.

ELNOD.description: : Element node (max. 2 for pipe and spring, max. 1 for cont and body502)

PIPE31-33.description: , SPRING137, BODY502 : element types with TYPE=1,2 1 :

REFSYS.description: : Reference coordinate system for the result, which can be assigned the values

SYS.description: =GLOBAL. The local system for the spring and pipe element types coincide with the element system as deﬁned by the ELORIENT card in Section 2.19. 70

RES_.description: with the I option (integration station results) can be applied. For deﬁnition of integration points for tubular and rectangular csoss sections, see Fig. 2.17. The format is as follows:

IGAU.description: : Element integration station 1-3, 1 and 3 at element ends.

IPOINT.description: : Integration point number, max npoint see Section 2.6.

IPOINT2.description: : Conceptual integration point. This applies to tensile armour models apply- ing either pipe52 or hshear364 which do not have a visual model of the local cross-section. It is then possible to decide where in the cross-section proﬁle (rect-

ELTY.description: : Element type. The complete list of available element types is given in Table 2.1 below.

NOD3.description: : Node id, optional depending of element type

NOD4.description: : Node id, optional depending of element type If the REPEAT command is introduced, the previous sequence is repeated: N:

233.description: • Add command line option to run Pflex: Syntax: pﬂex.exe -n preﬁx

235.description: -n: avoid interactive entering of .bpi ﬁle name and controlling parameters. The program will take preﬁx.bpi as the input ﬁle.

353.description: flexcross, see Section 2.10.2: 1. For all layers (element groups) ⩾ilaext, the same external pressure must be speciﬁed. Extenal pressure will then be applied to the outer surface of ilaext,

DOFS.description: at each end of the corresponding helix. In addition 2 two internal DOFs are used to allow accurate description of the longitudinal slip process. The torsion DOFs 4 and 10 are dummy. However, if the model includes a thick-walled based modelling

ALFA1.description: : Rayleigh damping factor for mass matrix contribution.

ALFA2.description: : Rayleigh damping factor for material stiﬀness matrix contribution.

UPDATE.description: =0 and can then not be changed during analysis restarts. ALFA1 and ALFA2 can however be changed if UPDATE=1 is applied. For two-noded elements, the same damping factors are applied at both element ends. Note that ALFA1 and ALFA2 are

ELTYP.description: : Type of element, which may have the following values:

XECC.description: : x-component eccentricity in element coordinates relative to the master node, see ex in Fig. 2.19 (unit: L).

YECC.description: : y-component eccentricity in element coordinates relative to the master node (unit: L).

ZECC.description: : z-component eccentricity in element coordinates relative to the master node, see ez in Fig. 2.19 (unit: L).

DZ2.description: : z-component eccentricity in element coordinates for the second roller end relative to the master node (unit: L).

YPHI.description: : Orientation angle of the roller system relative to the element system, see ϕ in Fig. 2.19. Deﬁned as positive for rotation about the negative y-axis of the

DX1.description: : x-component eccentricity in element coordinates for the ﬁrst roller end relative to the master node (unit: L).

DY1.description: : y-component eccentricity in element coordinates for the ﬁrst roller end relative to the master node (unit: L).

DZ1.description: : z-component eccentricity in element coordinates for the ﬁrst roller end relative to the master node (unit: L).

DX2.description: : x-component eccentricity in element coordinates for the second roller end relative to the master node (unit: L).

DY2.description: : y-component eccentricity in element coordinates for the second roller end relative to the master node (unit: L).

DYPHI.description: . If the parameter RADN is given, the stinger radius of curvature will be equal to DS divided by DYPHI between rollers i= 1 and i=2, and thereafter change linearly towards RADN between rollers i =N −1 and i =N.

RADN.description: : Stinger radius of curvature between the two last rollers, i = N −1 and i = N. Linear interpolation of the curvature radius is then applied between rollers i = 2

PEAT.description: card for ELECC STINGER, however, the RADIUS option has increased ﬂexibil- ity as the roller can rotation-symmetric about each of the three coordinate axes. The 86

IAXIS.description: : The element axis which the roller end eccentricity vectors is rotated about. The eccentricity vector for end 1 is deﬁned by DX1, DY1 and DZ1 and by DX2,

DPHI.description: : Constant angle increment for rotation about IAXIS=1,2 or 3. Positive rotation directions are deﬁned according to the right-hand rule (unit: rad).

ELIDN1.description: : The ﬁrst element ID of sequence n.

ELID11.description: : The ﬁrst element ID of sequence 1.

ELID12.description: : The last element ID of sequence 1. 90

HISTNO1.description: : The time history ID number for sequence 1.

ELIDN2.description: : The last element ID of sequence n.

HISTNON.description: : The time history ID number for sequence n.

ELNR1.description: : First element ID number. T1: Temperature of ﬁrst element (unit: TE).

ELNR2.description: : Last element ID number. T2: Temperature of last element (unit: TE). Linear interpolation is applied for the intermediate elements.

LOAD1.description: /LOAD2 is: 1 force in local x axis (unit: F)

EULERANGLE.description: . In case of COORDINATES the remaining parameters have the following meaning:

EPTYP.description: : Element property type as deﬁned above. The number and deﬁnition of the following parameters depend on the choice of element property type.

CMR.description: : Radial mass coeﬃcient (Normally 2.0 for circular pipes. This will result in an added mass of (RMADD −1.0)ρw

CMT.description: : Tangential mass coeﬃcient (Must be ≥1.0. A value of 1.0 will result in no tangential added mass according to the above formula.) (unit: -).

ODW.description: : External wrapping outer diameter Dow (unit: L)

PHIST.description: : External pressure and buoyancy mass history id.

ELTIME.description: =VALUE: The activation time for the elasto-plastic material model is spec- iﬁed by VALUE, i.e. the elements behave elastically until VALUE is exceeded.

AUTOPLAST.description: =VALUE: By specifying AUTOPLAST=1, the elements behave elas- tically until the proportionality limit is reached.

SHEARA.description: =VALUE: Shear deformations with a shear rigidity (shear area times shear modulus) given by VALUE will be applied. An inﬁnite shear stiﬀness results for

RADE.description: : External radius where external pressure acts (unit: L).

RADI.description: : Internal radius where internal pressure acts (unit: L).

TCURV.description: =VALUE: The activation time for the bending model is speciﬁed by VALUE. Gives zero bending internal moments and stiﬀness for zero moment until VALUE

INSIDE.description: : Parameter where 1 means that the master is inside the slave group of larger diameter, and any other value means that the master is outside the slave group.

COGY.description: : Local x-eccentricity from element origin to COG (unit: L).

WDTHX.description: : X-rotation structural mass at COG (unit: ML2).

WDTHY.description: : Y-rotation structural mass at COG (unit: ML2).

WDTHZ.description: : Z-rotation structural mass at COG (unit: ML2).

CDTHX.description: : Drag coeﬃcient for x-rotation at hydrodynamic center (unit: L5).

CDTHY.description: : Drag coeﬃcient for y-rotation at hydrodynamic center (unit: L5).

CDTHZ.description: : Drag coeﬃcient for z-rotation at hydrodynamic center (unit: L5).

CMX.description: : Added mass coeﬃcient for x-direction (unit: L3).

CMY.description: : Added mass coeﬃcient for y-direction (unit: L3).

CMZ.description: : Added mass coeﬃcient for z-direction (unit: L3).

CMTHX.description: : Added mass coeﬃcient for x-rotation at hydrodynamic center (unit: L5).

CMTHY.description: : Added mass coeﬃcient for y-rotation at hydrodynamic center (unit: L5).

CMTHZ.description: : Added mass coeﬃcient for z-rotation at hydrodynamic center (unit: L5).

COGX.description: : Local x-eccentricity from element origin to COG (unit: L).

COGZ.description: : Local x-eccentricity from element origin to COG (unit: L).

ICCHYD.description: : Hydrodynamic Coriolis-centripetal load switch, optional, default value: 0. 0 :

HCX.description: : Local x-eccentricity from element origin to hydrodynamic center, optional, de- fault value: COGX(unit: L).

HCY.description: : Local y-eccentricity from element origin to hydrodynamic center, optional, de- fault value: COGY(unit: L).

HCZ.description: : Local z-eccentricity from element origin to hydrodynamic center, optional, de- fault value: COGZ(unit: L).

CONTPAR1.description: = is a character string and VALUE is an integer equal to either 0 or 1. For VALUE=0 which is default, an arbitrary number of contact elements may obtain contact with the same pipe element. If VALUE=1,

CONTPAR2.description: = is a character string and VALUE is an integer that deﬁnes the number of pipe elements a contact point is allowed to move along during one increment or iteration step before the contact is deactivated. For the

TPAR2.description: =VALUE option is currently only available for cont164 in combination with the ISOKXYCONTACT material type in Section 2.26.11. The CONTPAR1=VALUE option is applied in situations where two or more contact

IREF.description: : Integer parameter for controlling the reference coordinate system applied for the material curves, the element displacements and the element forces. Further

ICOULCNTR.description: : Integer parameter for controlling the COULOMB force scaling option speciﬁed by the GENSPRING material type in Section 2.26.16. Further descrip-

COULOMB.description: : The XNAME and PXNAME_I curves are scaled by the product of the local z-direction force and MUX, while the YNAME and PYNAME_I

STEP.description: : Load step at which the friction spring in local curvilinear helix system is acti- vated.

CONMAT.description: : The name of the contact material describing the helix radial stiﬀness and the longitudinal helix friction properties

LAYANG.description: : Helix lay angle α, positive according to the right hand rule as in Fig. 2.27

ELSE.description: : Friction stress analysis is carried out.

TTIME.description: : The time when friction is activated. Default: 0.0 Unit: s

NBACK.description: : Number of ordinary helix lengths used for turning direction, see Fig. 2.28.

NUSUAL.description: : Number of ordinary helix pitches between turning direction, see Fig. 2.28.

GAP0.description: : Initial gap. Default value =0.0, Unit: L. A non-zero value is only applicable

CNTR1.description: : For hcont454 this is the ﬁll factor. i.e. the fraction ﬁlled by the cross- section of wires with respect to the layer circumference. Dummy for other hcont

CNTR2.description: : A contact search parameter that is only relevant for hcont453 and hcont464. Default:e 0.0 If set to 1 for hcont453 an update contact search will be carried

SCALEFACT.description: : Ratio between total number of helices in a layer and the number of helices used to represent that layer (i.e. It is not necessary to represent all 70

GEOTYPE.description: : Geometry type, TUBE, RECTANGLE or TAPE for element type hs- hear363.

AXISYM.description: : Allowing the user to control the shear interaction behaviour of the hs- hear353 element. If AXISYM = 2 then the bending shear interaction is turned

THISTTX.description: : Time history for scaling of spring moment and stiﬀness about pipe axial rotation DOF.

TTX.description: : Activation time for spring about pipe axial rotation DOF.

THISTX.description: : Time history for scaling of spring force and stiﬀness in pipe axial direction.

THISTUZ.description: : Time history for scaling of KP-based soil embedment. Optional.

UZNAME.description: : Table name for KP-based soil embedment. Optional. The main purpose of the time-controlled soil springs is to enhance the modelling capa-

116.description: forces and moments, and will be included in results reported by Bflex2010post. The element property type is optional. No time-controlled springs will be present if the

NFDPO.description: : The number of points in the fatigue S-N diagram R :

IGERB.description: : Method for taking the mean stress into account 0 :

INTCO.description: : Method for interpolation in S-N diagram: 1 :

NSEG.description: : Number of segments in the geometry. A geometry can be built from several segment types aligned after each other in the sequence they are given in the geometry card.

THETA.description: : Angle of node coordinate. Under option POLAR the REPEAT sequence has the following parameters:

RADSTART.description: : Curvature radius at start of segment. (unit: L)

RADEND.description: : Rate of curvature radius change along segment so that 1/Rad=1/Radstart+1/Radend*s where s is curvilinear length along segment

PHI0.description: : Slope at start of segment. The slope is measured along the longitudinal direc- tion, and relative to the center line of the bellmouth.

ISTR1.description: /ISTR2 is 1 axial strain along local x axis (unit: -)

ISTR2.description: : Initial strain for the last element, optional. Linear interpolation is applied for intermediate elements. If the REPEAT command is used then the previous sequence of load generation is

THE.description: friction moment point from the value given on the material curve deﬁned at reft by linear temperature scaling(unit: C−1).

PX_NX.description: : Penetration value at which the last penetration-dependent material curve in local x-direction is valid. Positive for penetration into the seabed. Not speciﬁed

PYNAME_1.description: : Local y-direction ﬁrst penetration-dependent material curve name. The curve must be hyper-elastic. Not speciﬁed for NY=0. Optional.

MUY.description: : Friction coeﬃcient in local y-direction. Negative value will provide isotropic friction based on MUX (unit: -).

XYCHOICE.description: : Enables the user to overrule the Coulomb friction concept by userdeﬁned characteristics i x- and y - directions by introducing the parameter USERDE-

USERDEFINED.description: : The XNAME, YNAME, TXNAME, PXNAME_I and PY-

COULOMB-COULOMB-COULOMB.description: : Scaling according to COULOMB is ap- plied for all material curves for the local x- and y-directions and the local

COULOMB-USERDEFINED-USERDEFINED.description: : Scaling according to COULOMB for XNAME, YNAME and TXNAME, and USERDEFINED characteristics

PXNAME_I.description: curves and the third word governs the PYNAME_I curves. This is con- venient when describing soil resistance where one part is related to COULOMB and the second part is related to earth pressure resistance better described by a USERDE-

USERDEFINED-USERDEFINED-USERDEFINED.description: : The curves as deﬁned by the user are applied for all material curves for the local x-direction, the lo-

USERDEFINED-USERDEFINED-COULOMB.description: : Scaling according to COULOMB for PYNAME_I, and USERDEFINED characteristics applied for XNAME,

PX_1.description: : Penetration value at which the ﬁrst penetration-dependent material curve in local x-direction is valid. Positive for penetration into the seabed. Not speciﬁed

PXNAME_1.description: : Local x-direction ﬁrst penetration-dependent material curve name. The curve must be hyper-elastic. Not speciﬁed for NX=0. Optional.

PXNAME_NX.description: : Local x-direction last penetration-dependent material curve name. The curve must be hyper-elastic. Not speciﬁed for NX=0,1. Optional.

PY_1.description: : Penetration value at which the ﬁrst penetration-dependent material curve in local y-direction is valid. Positive for penetration into the seabed. Not speciﬁed

PY_NY.description: : Penetration value at which the last penetration-dependent material curve in local y-direction is valid. Positive for penetration into the seabed. Not speciﬁed

PYNAME_NY.description: : Local y-direction last penetration-dependent material curve name. The curve must be hyper-elastic. Not speciﬁed for NY=0,1. Optional.

138.description: a consecutive number of points deﬁning displacement versus force per unit length or force, i.e. no scaling with µFz is applied.

KEL1.description: KEL2 frac kdyn C1 C2 dim ksurf

KEL2.description: : Elastic shear stiﬀness in transverse direction. Default: 1.0109 Unit: N m2

FRAC.description: : The ratio between the transition slip distance (from static friction to dynamic friction) and the elastic distance (from zero to static friction) Default: 0.1

KDYN.description: : Stiﬀness after the transition to dynamic friction. This stiﬀness might be set to a small positive value to improve numerical stability. Default: 0.0

DIM.description: : Dimension of model (1, 11, 12, -1, -11 -12= 1D 2, -2 = 2D). The negative values only applies for the Coulomb friction model type=6. By specifying a postive

KSHEAR.description: : Shear stiﬀness. Default: 1.0109 Unit: N m2 In lack of other information, the

KTRANS.description: : Transverse elastic stiﬀness Default: 0.0 (unit: N m2)

MUTX.description: : Friction coeﬃcient in local y-direction due to x-rotation (unit: -).

XMATNAME.description: : Axial x-direction material curve name, using ep- or hycurve.

POLAR.description: : Nodal points are given in a polar coordinates system for HSHEAR352. Local origo and orientation of the polar system must be speciﬁed. Nodal coordinates will be described along local x-axis by deﬁning radius, angles

ROTDISP.description: : Enables the user to rotate and displace a given set of coordinates If option COORDINATES is selected, the NOCOOR card has the following ele- ments:

ZCOR.description: : z-coordinate. Under option COORDINATES, the REPEAT card has the following parameters:

BETA3.description: : Rotation about z for local system. R:

THETAINC.description: : Increment in angle. If option ROTDISP is selected, the NOCOOR card has the following elements.

154.description: RI: Inner radius at node j (unit: L). The NODPROP command allows adjusting the element geometry properties of pipe31,

PRESHIST.description: : External pressure and buoyancy mass history number.

GRAVHIST.description: : Dry mass history number. Refer to the concepts of dry mass and dry buoyancy mass concepts applied in the

158.description: P2: Internal pressure of last element (unit: FL−2). Linear interpolation is applied

REELGRP.description: : Name of the pipe group intended for REELING.

ROPIPE.description: : Outer radius of the reeled pipe.

SPOOLSPRGRP.description: : Name of group containing “spring elements” in spool.

SPOOLCOGRP.description: : Name of group containing “contact elements” in spool.

ROLLCOGRP.description: : Name of group for “contact element” in roll.

FCLIMROLL.description: : Contact-force cut-oﬀlimit for spool. The sequence ROLLGRP ROLLCOGRP RROLL FCLIMROLL can be repeated to model multiple rolls.

T11.description: : Value of entry (1,1), ﬁrst arguement value

TN1.description: : Value of entry (n,1), last argument value.

NCOL.description: : Number of columns in table. Must be larger than or equal to 2.

T12.description: : Value of entry (1,2), ﬁrst function value of column 2.

T1_NCOL.description: : Value of entry (1,ncol), ﬁrst function value of last column.

TN2.description: : Value of entry (n,2), last function value of column 2.

TN_NCOL.description: : Value of entry (n,ncol), last function value of last column. The ﬁrst column deﬁnes the argument values, and the other columns deﬁne the function values. Linear interpolation of the function values are applied in between the argument

FAC1.description: : Load factor for time t1. T2: Time t2.

FAC2.description: : Load factor for time t2 An arbitrary sequence may be given, and linear interpolation is applied between the time steps deﬁned by the TIMECO card above. For t ∈[T1 , T2] the load factor will

TFILE.description: : ﬁle name containing the parameters t1,fac1,t2,fac2...,deﬁned above 2.35.2

PHASE.description: : Phase displacement, ϕ. The load factor at any time t, is then deﬁned by: F = sin(ωt + ϕ)

RAMPTYPE.description: : Type of ramping, only RAMPCOS allowed.

FAC.description: : Load factor after the ramping. The shape of the ramping function is a half cosine period, starting at zero slope. Be- tween ramping periods, the load factor is keept constant at the value obtained in the

DTVI.description: : Time increment between each restart/visual storage to the .raf ﬁle.

DT0.description: : Time increment between each zero setting of the accumulated convergence control vectors.

ITCRIT.description: : Iteration criterion parameter, enables the user to select between alternative incremental norms scaled with respect to the associated accumulated norms. Must be given if STEPTYPE is given.

AUTO.description: : If required tolerance is not met within MAXIT, the step is subdivided in two parts. This is repeated until required tolerance is met within MAXIT or

ITERCO.description: : Iteration control parameter. Must be given if STEPTYPE is given.

GO-ON.description: : the program proceeds after the maximum number of iterations is reached

MAXDIV.description: : Maximum number of sub-divisions. Must be given if STEPTYPE is given.

FEM.description: results according to the list deﬁned below is enabled in- cluding consistent representation of all numerical elements of the FEM model in xpost including the applied element and node numbers. In addition to

168.description: the list below ﬁnite element resultant force results of all pipe elements is allowed for. Other options are deprecated, but this value are kept for back-

FACTOR.description: : Scaling factor for all radial quantities (scale pipe radius).

RESULT.description: : Result types that will be stored, can be a list. Options are:

SIGMA-XY.description: : σxy Shear stress at mean surface (pipe elements).

STRAIN-XX.description: : εxx Longitudinal strain at mean surface - (pipe elements).

STRAIN-YY.description: : εyy Hoop strain at mean surface (pipe elements).

STRAIN-XY.description: : εxy Shear strain at mean surface (pipe elements).

ACCSTRAIN.description: : εtot Total longitudinal strain (elastoplastic pipe elements).

SIGMA-XXI.description: : σxxi Longitudinal stress at inner surface (elastic pipe elements).

SIGMA-YYI.description: : σyyi Hoop stress at inner surface-thickwalled theory (elastic pipe elements).

SIGMA-XYI.description: : σxyi Shear stress at inner surface (elastic pipe elements).

SIGMA-XXO.description: : σxxo Longitudinal stress at outer surface (elastic pipe elements).

SIGMA-YYO.description: : σyyo Hoop stress at outer surface-thickwalled theory (elastic pipe elements).

SIGMA-XYO.description: : σxyo Shear stress at outer surface (elastic pipe elements).

VCONDIS-Z.description: , VCONFOR-X and VCONFOR-Z can be used to obtain the bending induced eﬀects. These are deﬁned by the contact material in the ELPROP card of the helix.

VCONFOR-X.description: : Contact element local x-force (unit: See Table 2.1)

VCONFOR-Y.description: : Contact element local y-force (unit: See Table 2.1)

VCONFOR-Z.description: : Contact element local z-force (unit: See Table 2.1)

SIGMA-XX-C1.description: : Longitudinal stress in corner 1 of tensile armour. Only for

SIGMA-XX-C2.description: : Longitudinal stress in corner 2 of tensile armour. Only for

SIGMA-XX-C3.description: : Longitudinal stress in corner 3 of tensile armour. Only for

SIGMA-XX-C4.description: : Longitudinal stress in corner 4 of tensile armour. Only for

SIGMA-XX-AX.description: : Axial stress in tendon. Only for pipe52, uchshear352 and

SIGMA-XX-MY.description: : Longitudinal stress due to bending about weak axis. Only for pipe52, uchshear352 and hshear353 elements.

SIGMA-XX-MZ.description: : Longitudinal stress due to bending about strong axis (i.e. about surface normal). Only for pipe52, uchshear352 and hshear353 ele-

YSCL.description: : Scaling factor to be used for y-axis (to convert to convenient unit).

RAFPRE.description: : The Bflex2010post raf-ﬁle name preﬁx. If the ﬁle name is deﬁned by a combination of lower case and upper case letters, use e.g. ’input-ﬁlename’.

MPFPRE.description: : The output .mpf ﬁle name preﬁx. If the ﬁle name is deﬁned by a combination of lower case and upper case letters, use e.g. ’mpf-ﬁlename’.

XLEG.description: : The legend name for the x-axis. If the legend name contains more than one word or if the name is deﬁned by a combination of lower case and upper case letters, use e.g. ’Displacement (m)’.

XRES.description: : x-axis result type. The following result types are available:

HISTN.description: : History number with reference to Bflex2010 input ﬁle, e.g. HIST100

YLEG.description: : The legend name for the y-axis. If the legend name contains more than one word or if the name is deﬁned by a combination of lower case and upper case letters, use e.g. ’Displacement (m)’.

YRES.description: : y-axis result type. All the result types deﬁned as integration point results. In addition, the following result types can be applied:

FNODEID.description: : First element ID number in numerical model.

LNODEID.description: : Last element ID number in numerical model.

XSCL.description: : Scaling factor to be used for x-axis (to convert to convenient unit).

FELID.description: : First element ID number in numerical model.

LELID.description: : Last element ID number in numerical model.

LSECID.description: : Integration section number along element. Max 2 for PIPE31, PIPE34 and

PIPE37.description: . Max 3 for PIPE33, PIPE36, PIPE39, COMPIPE42 and CABLE111.

CSECID.description: : Integration section number in cross-section. The total number is given in the control card of the SIMLA analysis.

ELMOM-X.description: : Mx moment about centroid x-axis (unit: Nmm)

ELMOM-Y.description: : My moment about centroid y-axis (unit: Nmm)

ELMOM-Z.description: : Mz moment about centroid z-axis (unit: Nmm)

ELDISP-X.description: : Local element x displacement (element elongation for beams) (unit: L)

ELDISP-Y.description: : Local element y displacement (zero for beam) (unit: L)

ELDISP-Z.description: : Local element z displacement (zero for beam) (unit: L)

ELROT-X.description: : Local x-rotation (rigid body rotation eliminated for beam) (unit: R)

ELROT-Y.description: : Local y-rotation (rigid body rotation eliminated for beam) (unit: R)

ELROT-Z.description: : Local z-rotation (rigid body rotation eliminated for beam) (unit: R)

CONDIS-X.description: : Contact element displacement in local x-direction (unit: L)

CONDIS-Y.description: : Contact element displacement in local y-direction (unit: L)

CONDIS-Z.description: : Contact element displacement in local z-direction (surface normal) (unit: mm ).

CONFOR-X.description: : Contact element force in local x-direction (unit: FL−1 for all con- tact elements except cont130 having unit: F ).

CONFOR-Y.description: : Contact element force in local y-direction (unit: FL−1 for all con- tact elements except cont130 having unit: F ).

CONFOR-Z.description: : Contact element force in local z-direction (surface normal) (unit: N ).

INICUR-Y.description: : initial curvature about local y-axis (unit: L−1)

INICUR-Z.description: : initial curvature about local z-axis (unit: L−1)

ICONDIS-X.description: : Contact element initial displacement in local x-direction (unit: L)

ICONDIS-Y.description: : Contact element initial displacement in local y-direction (unit: L)

ICONDIS-Z.description: : Contact element initial displacement in local z-direction (unit: L)

T-COR.description: : Polar theta coordinate (for elements connected to nodes generated by this option) (unit: R)

A-COR.description: : Polar lay angle (for elements connected to nodes generated by this option) (unit: R)

K-COR.description: : curvilinear xy-coordinate, i.e. kp-coordinate for pipeline problems re- quires that a seabed has been deﬁned in Bflex2010 (unit: L)

INTPOI.description: : Integration point number (around cross section, point 1 start at local y=radius and z = 0 and then clockwise). If no integration point, this is the negative refer- ence load step number. Default value: 1

NLOADSTEP.description: : If a positive load step number is given, then the results will be measured relative to the state at that step. If no or a negative loadstep is given, then actual values are used. Default value: 0

LOFPRE.description: : The output .lof ﬁle name preﬁx. If the ﬁle name is deﬁned by a combination of lower case and upper case letters, use e.g. ’fat-ﬁlename’. I3: the number of load cycles.

FTIME.description: : the ﬁrst load step for calculating stress range.

LTIME.description: : the last load step point for calculating stress range.

OPTSTR.description: : Option for stress range calculation. ̸= 1 : Stress range is taken to be the diﬀerence between the stress ranges obtained

UNTCONV.description: : unit conversion factor to ﬁt the fatigue data. 3.9

MX-REACT.description: : Mx moment about centroid x-axis (unit: FL)

MY-REACT.description: : My moment about centroid y-axis (unit: FL)

MZ-REACT.description: : Mz moment about centroid z-axis (unit: FL)

MX-DAMP.description: : Mx damping moment about centroid x-axis (unit: FL)

MY-DAMP.description: : My damping moment about centroid y-axis (unit: FL)

MZ-DAMP.description: : Mz damping moment about centroid z-axis (unit: FL)

MX-INER.description: : Mx inertia moment about centroid x-axis (unit: FL)

MY-INER.description: : My inertia moment about centroid y-axis (unit: FL)

MZ-INER.description: : Mz inertia moment about centroid z-axis (unit: FL)

MY-ALL.description: : My restoring+damping+inertia moment about centroid y-axis (unit: FL)

MZ-ALL.description: : Mz restoring+damping+inertia moment about centroid z-axis (unit: FL)

IEND.description: : The element end that shall contribute. Default value = 0 means that all element ends are considered. 3.10

FNODID.description: : First node ID number in numerical model.

NODESCL.description: : Scaling factor to be used for node number (i = i - NODESCL ).

VALSCL.description: : Scaling factor to be used for x-,y and z-values (xi = xi * VALSCL) . The output ﬁle format is: Node number, Xi , Yi , Zi , T11, T12, T13, T21, T22, T23, T31, T32, T33

PFLEXMESH.description: : Mesh factor for pflex model. Default = 1

ITRANS.description: : If the value 1 is given the element end reactions are transformed to global system. Default value: 0

A7-AN.description: : preﬁx of all dyn ﬁles to be processed

I3B.description: : optional parameter. If speciﬁed, the plot number range i3-i3b will be stored to the same .mpf ﬁle

INDICATES.description: A graphical representation of the failure mechanism and the pipe conﬁguration in a failed pipe model are shown in Fig. 9.14. It is seen that severe global torsion deformation occurs during failure.
